intro: Cleistanthopsis multicaulis, commonly known as the clustered cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
